intro: Leptochloa virgata var. gracilis, commonly known as slender spikegrass, is a grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
